Sentencas: One of the major obstacles to improving electrochemical performance of SOFCs is the limitation with respect to current collecting.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The aim of this study is to examine these limitations on the basis of a model of a single cell of tubular SOFC.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The simulation results allow us to understand and analyze the effects of ionic and electronic ohmic drops on cell performance.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: This paper describes a model using the CFD-Ace software package to simulate the behaviour of a tubular SOFC.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: Modelling is based on solving conservation equations of mass, momentum, energy, species and electric current by using a finite volume approach on 3D grids of arbitrary topology.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The electrochemistry in the porous gas diffusion electrode is described using Butler-Volmer equations at the triple phase boundary.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The electrode overpotential is computed at each spatial location within the catalyst layer by separately solving the electronic and ionic electric potential equations.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The 3D presentation of the current densities and the electronic and ionic potentials allows analysis of the respective ohmic drops.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The simulation results show that the principal limitations are at the cathodic side.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The limitations due to ionic ohmic drops, classically considered to be the main restrictions, are confirmed.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)

Sentencas: The particular interest of our study is that it also shows that, because of the cylindrical geometry, there is a significant electronic ohmic drop.
Titulo: Current and voltage distributions in a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)
